alert.note: Alert for Hocking; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Central Ohio, including the following counties, Hocking and Pickaway. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Logan, Nelsonville, Hocking Hills State Park, Laurelville, Murray City, Tarlton, Gibisonville, Lake Logan State Park, Ilesboro, Buena Vista in Hocking County, Union Furnace, Haydenville, Whisler, Carbon Hill and Pickaway County Airport.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
